title: Small Team Format
description: Workshop adaptations for teams of 2-5 people
philosophy: Small teams are intimate - everyone participates in everything. The strength is depth of connection and shared understanding. Every voice is essential.

strengths: All voices can be heard in every discussion
challenges: Single points of failure if someone is absent
Games designed for larger groups need adaptation

general_adaptations.facilitation: More conversational, less structured. AI facilitator can engage each person directly.
general_adaptations.timing: Workshops can be shorter - less transition time between activities
general_adaptations.participation: Full participation in all activities - no observers
general_adaptations.games: All games played together - no team splits

W1_vision_quest.future_headlines: Each person writes 3-5 headlines, all share and discuss together
W1_vision_quest.stakeholder_safari: Each person role-plays 2-3 different stakeholders sequentially
W1_vision_quest.mission_discussion: Fluid conversation rather than structured facilitation

W2_ethics_arena.dilemma_duel: Whole group debates each dilemma together - assign devil's advocate role
W2_ethics_arena.value_auction: Individual bidding with personal point allocation
W2_ethics_arena.boundary_discussion: Open discussion rather than structured format

W3_stack_safari.architecture_pictionary: Round-robin drawing, all participate in guessing

W4_agent_assembly.trading_cards: Each person creates 2-3 cards, all cards discussed
W4_agent_assembly.skill_bingo: Individual bingo cards, shared skill pool

W5_integration_celebration.demo_derby: Each person demos one artifact they're proud of
W5_integration_celebration.gratitude_circle: Full circle, everyone speaks to everyone

G1_future_headlines.modification: Each person writes 3-5 headlines, sharing in intimate round-robin
G1_future_headlines.benefit: More headlines per person, deeper discussion of each

G2_stakeholder_safari.modification: Each person role-plays 2-3 stakeholders, switching roles
G2_stakeholder_safari.benefit: Everyone develops empathy for multiple stakeholders

G4_dilemma_duel.modification: No team split - assign 'devil's advocate' to argue each position
G4_dilemma_duel.benefit: Everyone hears both sides, practices perspective-taking

G5_value_auction.modification: Individual bidding rather than team bidding
G5_value_auction.benefit: Individual preferences revealed without group pressure

G7_agent_trading_cards.modification: Each person creates 2-3 cards, all discussed together
G7_agent_trading_cards.benefit: More cards per person, ensures diverse ideas

G8_skill_bingo.modification: Individual cards, collaborative calling and discussion

G9_architecture_pictionary.modification: All participate in both drawing and guessing rounds

G11_gratitude_circle.modification: Full circle with time for each person to speak to each other

facilitation_tips: Use first names frequently - intimacy is an asset
Allow tangents - small groups can dive deep without losing others
If energy drops, take a short walk-and-talk break
Celebrate when everyone agrees - it's a sign of deep alignment
Watch for the quiet person - in a group of 5, being quiet is very visible
Consider rotating facilitator role to share leadership
success_indicators: Every person speaks in every session
Team develops inside jokes and shared references
Decisions feel unanimous rather than majority
Artifacts feel like collective creation, not individual work
